title: Firehouse Lawyer
summary: The newsletter covers several key legal updates, including mask guidelines for public safety, the implementation of the Long-Term Services and Support Act (LTCP) in Washington state, the potential impact of the Affordable Care Act on ground ambulance services through GEMT payments, considerations for law enforcement's use of force under new emergency management legislation, requirements for in-person meetings during public health emergencies, data sharing agreements (DSAs), medical record retention rules post-COVID-19, a Supreme Court ruling on media access during public events, and implications for contract law regarding ambulance providers.
compressed_content: 1. Mask Guidelines: Mandatory masks for fully vaccinated individuals. 2. LTCP Implementation: New law requires 40% of agencies to implement by July 2022. 3. ACA/GEMT Status: GEMT payments depend on the existence of the ACA. 4. Emergency Force Use: Law enforcement must use reasonable force and prioritize vulnerable individuals. 5. In-Person Meetings: Agencies must comply with state emergency guidelines for public health events. 6. DSAs Required: Public agencies must obtain DSA agreements for data sharing. 7. Medical Record Retention: Non-minors' records can remain until 8 years post-service, while minors' records extend to age 21. 8. Media Access Ruling: Legal entities not incorporated as news media cannot access public records. 9. Contract Law Implications: Fire departments face challenges under new emergency management legislation.
